transcript.content: Eminem, Lose Yourself on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant, but not Karl Pilkington.
No, Karl, no.
He's gone back to 'Manchester Innit'. 'It's better than London. You don't know it! You don't know it! Manchester's better than London.' Instead Claire Sturgess.
Claire Sturgess, round of applause for Clare, yeah.
Ricky claps.
Thanks, yeah, thanks.
She's come in in the sort of camoflauge gear ... is that quite trendy? Is that what the kids are wearing?
D'you know, it's funny, someone actually mentioned to me ...
Or are are on maneuvers?
I am actually, yeah, taking time out this morning from what I normally do.
Sure.
I missed the ... erm ... second half, talking about that, of Celebrity Boot Camp.
I don't know what that is.
Coolio ... the fella from Milli Vanilli.
What, the one that's not dead?
Eh?
No, the one that killed himself Steve.
Sure.
Claire laughs.
I just wanted to clarify for people, a lot of people don't realise that one of them is dead. I thought it was important to mention it.
Actually, d'ya know, I didn't know.
No ...
It was a piece of interesting Milli Vanilli trivia that I had and I wanted to slip it in.
It isn't really trivia, because it was a question ... you went 'what, the one who's not dead?'
What I'm saying is that I could have found a more tactful way of bringing up the death of one of Milli Vanilli, because I think there's a lot of people out there who are now upset.
Actually, yeah, people who didn't know ...
That's quite a shock, I didn't ... I should've sat people down.
Who died? Vanilli or Milli?
I think it was ... it was Milli.
No it's Vanilli.
I don't know ...
No but I didn't know ... I'm guessing, actually I'm guessing.
I'm not confusing Milli Vanilli and Scritti Polliti am I?
Ricky laughs.
Because that is a danger.
You're thinking of the fella out of Grumple Palumple.
Steve laughs.
He was amazing.
He was amazing, it's a great shame that he topped himself.
Yeah, Grumple Palumple ... they're not with us.
Anyway, erm, cor, we've got some great tunes lined up. We're gonna play, today, erm, our favourite singles of the year.
Well, it's favourite tunes, some of which didn't quite make it as singles maybe, but tunes of the year cos obviously christmas is very soon, and we'll be away for a short time.
I think next week we'll be doing our favourite christmas songs of all time.
Yeah I'm worried that we're not gonna fill two hours with that, I mean how many times can you play Shakin Stevens before ...
And 'Fairytale of New York'.
Yeah exactly, that's the only one isn't it really.
That's the best one, that's the best Christmas song.
That one's good, but obviously there's Joni Mitchell's 'The River', that starts with a kinda Christmassy feel.
Beautiful, beautiful.
I'm wondering if there's anything else ... not a great deal.
The Waitresses - Christmas Wrapping.
Is that one?
Is that brilliant? Is that good?
Er ... 'So This is Christmas', John Lennon. Paul McCartney came out with 'Simply Having a Wonderful Christmas Time'.
Yeah, but John's was 'Happy Christmas War is Over'.
Yeah.
Of course, it wasn't.
Eh, but I mean, at least he wanted it to be.
Yeah, at least he's dreaming of it, dreaming of it, bless 'im.
And to show ...
John Lennon's dead as well, I don't know anyone's aware of that as well, just another bit of rock and roll trivia.
I like John's protest against war, he stayed in bed for a week. I've been doing that, I've been protesting against war for ages. I'm eating hamburgers against war.
Steve laughs.
Yeah ...
I went into Burger King on the way here, I went up to the counter ...
Let's not ... that's not product placement there. There's a number of other burger joints that people may wish to go to
I often go to McDonalds. I often go to McDonalds.
Erm ... but I went into Burger King, 'cos it's close, and I went in there ...
It's convinient, but often
McDonald's would be convenient.
McDonald's is just convenient, depends where you are.
Just as convenient, depending where you are.

Um, and I said err, I said can I have a cheeseburger and small fries. Takeaway please. And he recognised me, he went, "Oh I've seen you on telly. There's your meal sir". I went, "Thanks". He went, he winked and went, "I put large fries in".
Steve and Claire Laugh
Brilliant!
So it's paying off. At last true genius is being rewarded.
But I'm just intrigued to know, because there's been a couple of times where I've been with you and you know we've gone in a restaurant and
Someone's given you a free meal or whatever. It's the way that it's like you don't ask for it, it's just kind of offered. But I don't know what they're expecting in return.
Nothing!
I mean do they think that you'll go away and you'll always think fondly of Chad who works in Burger King?
No! No, I just think they think ooh I dunno.
I'm gonna give him a little treat.
Yeah. I know, I don't like it but then I'm always grateful and I never... But the thing is I'm slightly embarrassed.
Did anyone around you hear what had happened?
No.
Because I imagine their resentment, just the whole room turning on you.
No they didn't, I had to go round telling them! I went up and said, "Excuse me,
Did you hear that? He just gave me the free thing because I'm on the telly". And they went, "I don't recognise you". I went, "You don't recognise me?.
I'm terrified now that someone could be listening at Burger King HQ. You know, I'm assuming this is an unorthodox procedure.
Oh, and he could get in trouble!
And that little fella got fired.
They know it's Leicester Square now because I just mentioned it. So they know which Burger King it is.
Oh my God. I don't know...
What was his name?
Ralph Littleton. He had a name badge. Number 342.
Claire Laughs
Well I just hope Littleton doesn't get in trouble.
So, uh, what we gonna play first?
That could be a sad Christmas
For him. He's probably keeping his whole family afloat.
Um, bit of Springsteen.
Well, tunes of the year. I mean I know people dismiss Springsteen but as I say the gig I went to see earlier in the year, I made it in the end, it was quite brilliant.
Sturgess couldn't believe we were going to play Springsteen. She was...
I just think, you know, leave aside what you think is cool and trendy and the fact that he's older now.
Really? Really?
Just leave all that behind.
Yeah?
And just listen to the tunes. Because, you know, he remains a great musician.
'Lonesome Day'?
'Lonesome Day', it's the current single and it's the first track on the album.
Free. Free chips.
Steve Chuckles
BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN - LONESOME DAY
That's brilliant.
The boss.
Do we care if it's trendy?
I don't care.
We're like Huey Lewis, it's hip to be square Steve.
It's... That's... It's tr... We should play some Huey.
We can't, can we?
No, no.
Oh, come on. 'The Power Of Love'?
No!
Is a curious thing.
Yeah yeah. Makes one man weep and another man sing. Weird init.
It's bizarre isn't it, it's strange.
Aww flippin' heck.
Yeah, yeah.
Springsteen there.
Yeah, no, obviously he's playing again next year, sometime.
I bet even trendy people thought, "Well yeah, it's alright yeah". I bet they wanted to rock... I bet they wanted to drive along a freeway.
I think you've gotta be hard
Pushed to turn over the channel if you're driving and that's playing. Who wouldn't want to be driving a car while that's playing? Down an open freeway.
We are sounding... I know there's a little bit of irony in it but we are sounding like Doctor Fox. Did you see?! Did. You. See. The final of, um, 'Fame Academy'?
Now I don't watch 'Fame Academy'. I don't, I'm...
Foxy got in there, he was in the audience.
Really?!
No!
How did Foxy get in...
It's not enough being on 'Pop Idol', he's in there! And, do you know who was sitting next to him?
Next to Foxy.
In disguise.
In disguise?
In disguise. He had a little, a
Little beard and a woolly hat on. Looked like 'Badly Drawn Boy'. Mackenzie Crook.
Really?
And we had to, we taped it...
No.
Yeah, yeah. And I went, "It is". We taped it and he was there. So he's back from America and he...
Was it obviously a felt false beard?
No, no, I think he's...
Has he befriended Foxy?
I don't know!
Are they hanging out together now?
We're going to see him tonight. We're going to see him tonight.
What was he doing in the States then? What was he doing?
He's doing films.
He probably is wearing a beard. He plays... We can't say too much about it... He's playing a pirate I think.
Yeah. Yeah.
Ooh he'd make a good pirate.
Yeah, exactly. So far he's been cast as a pirate and a ghost. Which seems to make sense.
Oh, dear.
I'll be pumping him for information about Foxy because, you know, I'm a big fan of Foxy as you know.
I know.
Both a DJ and a medical man .
I like the, I like the way that you got pumping and Foxy in the same sentence.
Yeah, yeah, absolutely. Yeah.
I'd love to-
Did you just say you're going to see him tonight? Is it the comedy awards tonight?
Yeah.
Yeah, its the big 'Do'.
You're going obviously.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
What you wearing? What you wearing?
"What you wearing?"
Steve chuckles
Very boring I'm afraid.
What?
Very traditional tuxedos.
Tuxedos.
We went shopping together and bought them. It's quite sad I don't know if I should have said that.
Claire laughs
Lost a certain degree of rock-and-roll cool.

It was funny, because I went in and I went "42 chest, 36, 30 leg, that's fine right". Steve, right, then I had to stay there looking at Steve try on about nine jackets so the arms weren't too short. I suggested at one point going down to London Zoo and seeing what the gibbons wear because every single-
Those jackets you see them wear when there's an organ grinder.
Ricky laughs
Now who's making those?
Six foot nine. Oh dear.
Have you got the cummerbunds and things?
Well this is the thing, my father phoned up, you know I have conversations with my parents which are always, they'll phone up and it'll be like "alright how's it going? What you having for tea?"
Ricky laughs
"What am I having for tea? I'll probably have spaghetti Bolognese tonight dad." "Oh yeah" "What have you had dad?" "Ah your mother just made a lovely lasagne Steve"
Ricky laughs
I mean it literally, that's the conversation, its like yeah, every parent they're just interested in food. Food that you've eaten, food you're planning to eat, food you've enjoyed in the past.

Because they just want to know you're eating. "Have you got enough vitamin C? Got enough vitamin C tablets, because I can always send you some?" "I can buy them myself dad" "I'll send you some its not a problem" "Dad I don't need to". So anyway he says "What have you done?" and I'm trying to think and I think to myself he'll be impressed if I bought a tuxedo, I say I bought a tuxedo."
Will he like that?
He said "You bought a tuxedo, why didn't you rent it?" I said well it was quite cheap. He went "How cheap?". Told him the price, he went "Its not bad, not bad...
Steve imitates his dad shouting across to another room
"ELAINE, HE JUST BOUGHT A TUXEDO, HE JUST BOUGHT A TUXEDO ELAINE, YEP."
He said "Have you got a cummerband?"
Cummerbund.
A cummerbund. I said "do I need a cummerbund?". He said "Well...you gonna be dancing?"
Ricky and Claire laugh
Like he knows the rules.
Like he knows, like he's some kind of like, I don't think the man's ever worn a suit let alone a tuxedo, what does he know about "gonna be dancing?"
I love your dad.
I just love the idea of him being at some kind of do and "right Elaine, jackets off, cummerbunds on, time for a dance".
You know a cummerbund? You wear it over your braces? Because those things are, because you're not wearing a belt I assume.
No, you wear it under the braces I think.
No you don't.
No, do you? I don't know.
You wear it over it don't you.
Over the belt but braces are a different thing.
There's no belt. No belt on a tuxedo is there?
No you're right, no it is over the braces.
Sorry, how many people tuned to XFM are worrying about the etiquette of cummerbunds?
No, no, but this is important because the comedy awards which is going on, its live tonight.

I tell you this Rick, I tried on the tuxedo I bought yesterday, I got a new shirt as well, I look like James Bond. I'm not going to lie to you, no I do look like James Bond. I look exactly like him, its uncanny, it is uncanny.
Really? Because the bloke in there said you like a.
[~3 mins of missing transcription]

So obviously I've got to go back to- to Bristol. I love to see my family. Uhm, well, yeah, I do, uh but it means I'd see my grandparents who are, you know, brilliant people. I mean, lovely people, but mental--
Ricky laughs.

Utterly mental and- and they've taken now to- they must be sort of 80 a piece and that is quite an old age, but they're fairly good health relatively speaking and uhm, they just spend their time in bed. I mean, that's all they do is- that- that's their profession that's their, they've retired to go to bed and they spend all their time in bed--
I tell you what they're like, they're like that old- got-  they're like that old family in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.
Oh yeah.
Remember how none of them had got up--
Yeah.
For like 25 years.
Yeah.
And they--
You- you said that they go to bed, they go to sleep, but then, when they wake up, what they do is put an extra pillow, so there's slightly more upright--
Yeah.
And that's them in the day in bed.
Right, so that's active.
So, that's their- that's their- that's their daytime.
Yeah.
Yeah. But uhm--
But they get up and cook and stuff.
Well what they- well they mm yeah. Well what they do is they see they've got uhm

They've got about six teeth between them. Uhm, I mean, my grandmother wants false- needs false teeth, but refuses to go and have the old ones extracted and the false teeth fitted. So, she's, she's working with about three or four teeth.
Oh.
Uhm, my grandfather had false teeth given to him during the war.
Wooden ones?
Well it wa- it was plastic teeth on a wooden pallet, right? That sits at the top of the mouth. He's still got the wooden pallet, but most of the teeth have come off.
Claire chuckles.
So there's about four teeth left. Four--
Four false teeth. He's got four- he's got a set of false teeth that make him look like he needs false teeth.
Ricky laughs.
And that's pretty bizarre.
Soup.
Oh.

So the problem is that they have to get up. They get up at 7:00 in the morning to put on say, you know, some beef or lamb whichever they're going to cook. They put it on at 6:00 in the morning, 7:00 in the morning, so that by the time they eat it at 6:00 at night, they can use the phrase. This is what a good meal is for my grandparents, if they can use the phrase, "Oh, that's lovely. That's lovely. You could suck it away".
Claire laughs.
You could suck it away. Who wants that from a roast dinner? You may as well blend it up--
And serve it as a broth.
I don't want that phrase coming from old people without teeth.
No, indeed.
Claire laughs.
Because it remind- it must- it must remind you of your rent boy days.
Exactly. It brings it all flooding back, you know.
Oh. God.
Claire laughs.
(incoherent) - the word.
Exactly.
Ricky, Steve and Claire laugh together.
Should we play a record before we get really disgusting about your grandparents and blowjob--
Yeah. Please, please.
Oh dear.
Worst thing we've said.
We've said the word blowjob far too many times today.
And with- in the same sentence as your gra- I can't believe--
Anyway.
And it's Christmas.
Yeah.
Don't forget what Christmas is about.
Come on, spare a thought for the under privileged people.
Yeah.
(incoherent)
Steve. Steve.
Is it Ben Kweller. Do you wanna play a bit of Ben Kweller?
I'd love a bit of Ben Kweller. I dunno, are you a fan?
I love him.
Yeah--
Yeah.
Well, this is a cracking tune and uh-
Okay.
Yeah.
And uh,I think we'll enjoy this--
Slam-dunk it. It's quirky.
Why don't we just stop and think about what we've done?
Ricky laughs. Claire joins him.
They do spend so much time in- in bed that they actually- I'm sure war will--
Ben Kweller - In Other Words
Ben Kweller, In Other Words--
That's fantastic. That ending is- oh. Go- it's like Ben Folds, bit of old Elton. That's great.
You had him in sessions, didn't you, Claire?
Yeah, in fact--
Did you meet him or did you- cause he's quite young, isn't he?
He's very young. Uhm, he came in about six months ago--
To do something for John Kennedy and uhm, and I- also a session for me and I've been repeat- I repeated it this week as the best of the sessions cause it was- he did three songs, stunning stuff.
It's just him and a piano, was it? or him and a guitar?
It was just- yeah- it was just him.
Yeah. Yeah, yeah yeah.
Him with a couple of instruments.
Mm.
Uhm, stunning and also he did uhm, he did a Dingwalls gig for Xfm listeners and uh, the reaction from the listeners phoning up trying to get tickets was incredible.
Really?
He really has touched a nerve.
Yeah.
Well, like you say Ricky, I mean, it's really--
It's great.
Yeah.
Well I've just seen- we were talking there's a kinda
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Exactly yeah.
Well that's just part of your charm.
Well listen. That's been a lovely two hours for me. I've enjoyed it. I hope the listeners have enjoyed it. I hope you've enjoyed it. I hope Sturgess enjoyed it.
I've enjoyed it yeah.
Well, I didn't really care if you enjoyed it to be honest, so don't butt in when I'm talking to Steve. Yeah, you know, or you won't do it again.
You're here to press the buttons, Sturgess.
Yeah. But, um, we're going to play now a Christmas song for the lovely Christmas ladies.
I don't say it's so much Christmasy, but it's one of the tunes I've heard this year that really stuck out to me.
Well I'm trying to tie it into the festive theme, so.
Well, you're a fool. You've embarrassed yourself. You've just shown off that there's no planning.
Yeah.

This is, er, it was given away on a free CD on the cover of a magazine. I just think it's brilliant. It's Lamb Chop, who are an excellent band always, doing a cover of an obscure Rolling Stones tune called Backstreet Girl.
And I'll tell you what. A bloody good meal as well.
That's true enough. Um, so we'll leave them with this. It's Backstreet Girl, Lamb Chop, and see you next week for our final festive show.
"Lamb Chop"
Yeah thank you very much.
Embarrassing. Sometimes you're embarrassing, thank you.
♫ I don't want you to be high. ♫
